intro: Trichinium obovatum, commonly known as the broad-ovate trichinium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its obovate leaves that are often hairy and have a strong, aromatic scent. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Trichinium obovatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
